REST API Quotes - Extract¶

The get_author function takes in an id and returns the fullname of the author :param id_(author_id): The ID of the author in the MongoDB collection :type id_(author_id): int :return: The fullname of the author :rtype: str

REST API Quotes - Utils¶

quotes.utils.get_mongodb()¶

The get_mongodb function connects to the MongoDB database and returns the database object :return: A reference to the database instance :rtype: database

quotes.utils.scrape_and_save_data(url)¶

The scrape_and_save_data function takes in a URL and scrapes data from the website and saves it to the database :param url: The URL of the website to scrape :type url: str :return: A message indicating that the data was successfully saved :rtype: str :raises Exception: If the request fails

REST API Utils - Add quotes to Mongo¶

This script loads quotes from a JSON file and inserts them into a MongoDB database. Each quote is associated with an existing author in the database.

Dependencies:

  • ‘bson.objectid.ObjectId’ for working with MongoDB ObjectIds.

  • ‘quotes.utils.get_mongodb’ for establishing a database connection.

Database Collections:

  • ‘authors’: Stores author details, including ‘fullname’.

  • ‘quotes’: Stores quotes with references to authors.

Process:

  1. Reads ‘quotes.json’ from the current directory.

  2. Finds the corresponding author in the ‘authors’ collection by ‘fullname’.

  3. Inserts the quote into the ‘quotes’ collection, linking it to the author’s ObjectId.

REST API Utils - Migration¶

This script migrates data from a MongoDB database to a Django-based PostgreSQL or SQLite database. It transfers authors and quotes while preserving relationships and ensuring data integrity.

Dependencies:

  • ‘quotes.utils.get_mongodb’ for establishing a MongoDB connection.

  • ‘quotes.models.Author’, ‘quotes.models.Quote’, ‘quotes.models.Tag’ for Django ORM operations.

  • ‘Django’ for database interactions.

Process:

  1. Loads authors from MongoDB and creates corresponding ‘Author’ records in Django.

  2. Loads quotes from MongoDB, ensuring: - Tags are created or retrieved with a maximum length of 100 characters. - Quotes are added only if they don’t already exist in the database. - Each quote is linked to an existing author and associated tags.

Usage:
Run the script directly:

‘python migration.py’

utils.migration.migrate_data_from_mongo_to_django()¶
